segment_text: “My dear fellow,” said Sherlock Holmes as we sat on either side of the fire in his lodgings at Baker Street, “life is infinitely stranger than anything which the mind of man could invent.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: We would not dare to conceive the things which are really mere commonplaces of existence.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: If we could fly out of that window hand in hand, hover over this great city, gently remove the roofs, and peep in at the queer things which are going on, the strange coincidences, the plannings, the cross-purposes, the wonderful chains of events, working through generations, and leading to the most _outré_ results, it would make all fiction with its conventionalities and foreseen conclusions most stale and unprofitable.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And yet I am not convinced of it,” I answered.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “The cases which come to light in the papers are, as a rule, bald enough, and vulgar enough.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: We have in our police reports realism pushed to its extreme limits, and yet the result is, it must be confessed, neither fascinating nor artistic.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “A certain selection and discretion must be used in producing a realistic effect,” remarked Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “This is wanting in the police report, where more stress is laid, perhaps, upon the platitudes of the magistrate than upon the details, which to an observer contain the vital essence of the whole matter.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Depend upon it, there is nothing so unnatural as the commonplace.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I smiled and shook my head. “I can quite understand your thinking so,” I said.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Of course, in your position of unofficial adviser and helper to everybody who is absolutely puzzled, throughout three continents, you are brought in contact with all that is strange and bizarre.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: But here”—I picked up the morning paper from the ground—“let us put it to a practical test. Here is the first heading upon which I come.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: ‘A husband’s cruelty to his wife.’ There is half a column of print, but I know without reading it that it is all perfectly familiar to me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: There is, of course, the other woman, the drink, the push, the blow, the bruise, the sympathetic sister or landlady. The crudest of writers could invent nothing more crude.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Indeed, your example is an unfortunate one for your argument,” said Holmes, taking the paper and glancing his eye down it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “This is the Dundas separation case, and, as it happens, I was engaged in clearing up some small points in connection with it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The husband was a teetotaler, there was no other woman, and the conduct complained of was that he had drifted into the habit of winding up every meal by taking out his false teeth and hurling them at his wife, which, you will allow, is not an action likely to occur to the imagination of the average story-teller.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Take a pinch of snuff, Doctor, and acknowledge that I have scored over you in your example.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He held out his snuffbox of old gold, with a great amethyst in the centre of the lid.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Its splendour was in such contrast to his homely ways and simple life that I could not help commenting upon it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Ah,” said he, “I forgot that I had not seen you for some weeks. It is a little souvenir from the King of Bohemia in return for my assistance in the case of the Irene Adler papers.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And the ring?” I asked, glancing at a remarkable brilliant which sparkled upon his finger.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It was from the reigning family of Holland, though the matter in which I served them was of such delicacy that I cannot confide it even to you, who have been good enough to chronicle one or two of my little problems.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And have you any on hand just now?” I asked with interest.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Some ten or twelve, but none which present any feature of interest. They are important, you understand, without being interesting.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Indeed, I have found that it is usually in unimportant matters that there is a field for the observation, and for the quick analysis of cause and effect which gives the charm to an investigation.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The larger crimes are apt to be the simpler, for the bigger the crime the more obvious, as a rule, is the motive.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: In these cases, save for one rather intricate matter which has been referred to me from Marseilles, there is nothing which presents any features of interest.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is possible, however, that I may have something better before very many minutes are over, for this is one of my clients, or I am much mistaken.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He had risen from his chair and was standing between the parted blinds gazing down into the dull neutral-tinted London street.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Looking over his shoulder, I saw that on the pavement opposite there stood a large woman with a heavy fur boa round her neck, and a large curling red feather in a broad-brimmed hat which was tilted in a coquettish Duchess of Devonshire fashion over her ear.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: From under this great panoply she peeped up in a nervous, hesitating fashion at our windows, while her body oscillated backward and forward, and her fingers fidgeted with her glove buttons.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Suddenly, with a plunge, as of the swimmer who leaves the bank, she hurried across the road, and we heard the sharp clang of the bell.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I have seen those symptoms before,” said Holmes, throwing his cigarette into the fire. “Oscillation upon the pavement always means an _affaire de cœur_.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She would like advice, but is not sure that the matter is not too delicate for communication. And yet even here we may discriminate.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: When a woman has been seriously wronged by a man she no longer oscillates, and the usual symptom is a broken bell wire.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Here we may take it that there is a love matter, but that the maiden is not so much angry as perplexed, or grieved. But here she comes in person to resolve our doubts.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: As he spoke there was a tap at the door, and the boy in buttons entered to announce Miss Mary Sutherland, while the lady herself loomed behind his small black figure like a full-sailed merchant-man behind a tiny pilot boat.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes welcomed her with the easy courtesy for which he was remarkable, and, having closed the door and bowed her into an armchair, he looked her over in the minute and yet abstracted fashion which was peculiar to him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Do you not find,” he said, “that with your short sight it is a little trying to do so much typewriting?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I did at first,” she answered, “but now I know where the letters are without looking.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Then, suddenly realising the full purport of his words, she gave a violent start and looked up, with fear and astonishment upon her broad, good-humoured face.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You’ve heard about me, Mr. Holmes,” she cried, “else how could you know all that?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Never mind,” said Holmes, laughing; “it is my business to know things. Perhaps I have trained myself to see what others overlook.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: If not, why should you come to consult me?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I came to you, sir, because I heard of you from Mrs. Etherege, whose husband you found so easy when the police and everyone had given him up for dead.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Oh, Mr. Holmes, I wish you would do as much for me. I’m not rich, but still I have a hundred a year in my own right, besides the little that I make by the machine, and I would give it all to know what has become of Mr. Hosmer Angel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Why did you come away to consult me in such a hurry?” asked Sherlock Holmes, with his finger-tips together and his eyes to the ceiling.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Again a startled look came over the somewhat vacuous face of Miss Mary Sutherland. “Yes, I did bang out of the house,” she said, “for it made me angry to see the easy way in which Mr. Windibank—that is, my father—took it all.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He would not go to the police, and he would not go to you, and so at last, as he would do nothing and kept on saying that there was no harm done, it made me mad, and I just on with my things and came right away to you.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Your father,” said Holmes, “your stepfather, surely, since the name is different.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, my stepfather. I call him father, though it sounds funny, too, for he is only five years and two months older than myself.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And your mother is alive?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, yes, mother is alive and well. I wasn’t best pleased, Mr. Holmes, when she married again so soon after father’s death, and a man who was nearly fifteen years younger than herself.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Father was a plumber in the Tottenham Court Road, and he left a tidy business behind him, which mother carried on with Mr. Hardy, the foreman; but when Mr. Windibank came he made her sell the business, for he was very superior, being a traveller in wines.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: They got £ 4700 for the goodwill and interest, which wasn’t near as much as father could have got if he had been alive.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I had expected to see Sherlock Holmes impatient under this rambling and inconsequential narrative, but, on the contrary, he had listened with the greatest concentration of attention.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Your own little income,” he asked, “does it come out of the business?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, no, sir. It is quite separate and was left me by my uncle Ned in Auckland.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is in New Zealand stock, paying 4½ per cent. Two thousand five hundred pounds was the amount, but I can only touch the interest.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You interest me extremely,” said Holmes. “And since you draw so large a sum as a hundred a year, with what you earn into the bargain, you no doubt travel a little and indulge yourself in every way.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I believe that a single lady can get on very nicely upon an income of about £ 60.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I could do with much less than that, Mr. Holmes, but you understand that as long as I live at home I don’t wish to be a burden to them, and so they have the use of the money just while I am staying with them.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Of course, that is only just for the time. Mr. Windibank draws my interest every quarter and pays it over to mother, and I find that I can do pretty well with what I earn at typewriting.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It brings me twopence a sheet, and I can often do from fifteen to twenty sheets in a day.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You have made your position very clear to me,” said Holmes. “This is my friend, Dr. Watson, before whom you can speak as freely as before myself.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Kindly tell us now all about your connection with Mr. Hosmer Angel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: A flush stole over Miss Sutherland’s face, and she picked nervously at the fringe of her jacket. “I met him first at the gasfitters’ ball,” she said.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “They used to send father tickets when he was alive, and then afterwards they remembered us, and sent them to mother. Mr. Windibank did not wish us to go.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He never did wish us to go anywhere. He would get quite mad if I wanted so much as to join a Sunday-school treat.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: But this time I was set on going, and I would go; for what right had he to prevent? He said the folk were not fit for us to know, when all father’s friends were to be there.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: And he said that I had nothing fit to wear, when I had my purple plush that I had never so much as taken out of the drawer.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: At last, when nothing else would do, he went off to France upon the business of the firm, but we went, mother and I, with Mr. Hardy, who used to be our foreman, and it was there I met Mr. Hosmer Angel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I suppose,” said Holmes, “that when Mr. Windibank came back from France he was very annoyed at your having gone to the ball.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, well, he was very good about it. He laughed, I remember, and shrugged his shoulders, and said there was no use denying anything to a woman, for she would have her way.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I see. Then at the gasfitters’ ball you met, as I understand, a gentleman called Mr. Hosmer Angel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, sir. I met him that night, and he called next day to ask if we had got home all safe, and after that we met him—that is to say, Mr. Holmes, I met him twice for walks, but after that father came back again, and Mr. Hosmer Angel could not come to the house any more.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “No?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, you know father didn’t like anything of the sort. He wouldn’t have any visitors if he could help it, and he used to say that a woman should be happy in her own family circle.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: But then, as I used to say to mother, a woman wants her own circle to begin with, and I had not got mine yet.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “But how about Mr. Hosmer Angel? Did he make no attempt to see you?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, father was going off to France again in a week, and Hosmer wrote and said that it would be safer and better not to see each other until he had gone.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: We could write in the meantime, and he used to write every day. I took the letters in in the morning, so there was no need for father to know.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Were you engaged to the gentleman at this time?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, yes, Mr. Holmes. We were engaged after the first walk that we took. Hosmer—Mr. Angel—was a cashier in an office in Leadenhall Street—and—”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “What office?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “That’s the worst of it, Mr. Holmes, I don’t know.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Where did he live, then?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “He slept on the premises.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And you don’t know his address?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “No—except that it was Leadenhall Street.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Where did you address your letters, then?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “To the Leadenhall Street Post Office, to be left till called for. He said that if they were sent to the office he would be chaffed by all the other clerks about having letters from a lady, so I offered to typewrite them, like he did his, but he wouldn’t have that, for he said that when I wrote them they seemed to come from me, but when they were typewritten he always felt that the machine had come between us.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: That will just show you how fond he was of me, Mr. Holmes, and the little things that he would think of.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It was most suggestive,” said Holmes. “It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Can you remember any other little things about Mr. Hosmer Angel?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “He was a very shy man, Mr. Holmes. He would rather walk with me in the evening than in the daylight, for he said that he hated to be conspicuous.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Very retiring and gentlemanly he was. Even his voice was gentle.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He’d had the quinsy and swollen glands when he was young, he told me, and it had left him with a weak throat, and a hesitating, whispering fashion of speech.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He was always well dressed, very neat and plain, but his eyes were weak, just as mine are, and he wore tinted glasses against the glare.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, and what happened when Mr. Windibank, your stepfather, returned to France?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Mr. Hosmer Angel came to the house again and proposed that we should marry before father came back. He was in dreadful earnest and made me swear, with my hands on the Testament, that whatever happened I would always be true to him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Mother said he was quite right to make me swear, and that it was a sign of his passion. Mother was all in his favour from the first and was even fonder of him than I was.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Then, when they talked of marrying within the week, I began to ask about father; but they both said never to mind about father, but just to tell him afterwards, and mother said she would make it all right with him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I didn’t quite like that, Mr. Holmes. It seemed funny that I should ask his leave, as he was only a few years older than me; but I didn’t want to do anything on the sly, so I wrote to father at Bordeaux, where the company has its French offices, but the letter came back to me on the very morning of the wedding.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It missed him, then?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, sir; for he had started to England just before it arrived.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Ha! that was unfortunate. Your wedding was arranged, then, for the Friday. Was it to be in church?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, sir, but very quietly. It was to be at St. Saviour’s, near King’s Cross, and we were to have breakfast afterwards at the St. Pancras Hotel.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Hosmer came for us in a hansom, but as there were two of us he put us both into it and stepped himself into a four-wheeler, which happened to be the only other cab in the street.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: We got to the church first, and when the four-wheeler drove up we waited for him to step out, but he never did, and when the cabman got down from the box and looked there was no one there!
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The cabman said that he could not imagine what had become of him, for he had seen him get in with his own eyes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: That was last Friday, Mr. Holmes, and I have never seen or heard anything since then to throw any light upon what became of him.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It seems to me that you have been very shamefully treated,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, no, sir! He was too good and kind to leave me so. Why, all the morning he was saying to me that, whatever happened, I was to be true; and that even if something quite unforeseen occurred to separate us, I was always to remember that I was pledged to him, and that he would claim his pledge sooner or later.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It seemed strange talk for a wedding-morning, but what has happened since gives a meaning to it.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Most certainly it does. Your own opinion is, then, that some unforeseen catastrophe has occurred to him?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, sir. I believe that he foresaw some danger, or else he would not have talked so. And then I think that what he foresaw happened.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “But you have no notion as to what it could have been?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “None.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “One more question. How did your mother take the matter?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “She was angry, and said that I was never to speak of the matter again.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And your father? Did you tell him?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes; and he seemed to think, with me, that something had happened, and that I should hear of Hosmer again. As he said, what interest could anyone have in bringing me to the doors of the church, and then leaving me?
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Now, if he had borrowed my money, or if he had married me and got my money settled on him, there might be some reason, but Hosmer was very independent about money and never would look at a shilling of mine.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: And yet, what could have happened? And why could he not write? Oh, it drives me half-mad to think of it, and I can’t sleep a wink at night.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She pulled a little handkerchief out of her muff and began to sob heavily into it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I shall glance into the case for you,” said Holmes, rising, “and I have no doubt that we shall reach some definite result.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Let the weight of the matter rest upon me now, and do not let your mind dwell upon it further. Above all, try to let Mr. Hosmer Angel vanish from your memory, as he has done from your life.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Then you don’t think I’ll see him again?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I fear not.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Then what has happened to him?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You will leave that question in my hands. I should like an accurate description of him and any letters of his which you can spare.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I advertised for him in last Saturday’s _Chronicle_,” said she. “Here is the slip and here are four letters from him.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Thank you. And your address?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “No. 31 Lyon Place, Camberwell.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Mr. Angel’s address you never had, I understand. Where is your father’s place of business?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “He travels for Westhouse & Marbank, the great claret importers of Fenchurch Street.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Thank you. You have made your statement very clearly. You will leave the papers here, and remember the advice which I have given you.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Let the whole incident be a sealed book, and do not allow it to affect your life.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You are very kind, Mr. Holmes, but I cannot do that. I shall be true to Hosmer. He shall find me ready when he comes back.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: For all the preposterous hat and the vacuous face, there was something noble in the simple faith of our visitor which compelled our respect.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She laid her little bundle of papers upon the table and went her way, with a promise to come again whenever she might be summoned.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes sat silent for a few minutes with his fingertips still pressed together, his legs stretched out in front of him, and his gaze directed upward to the ceiling.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Then he took down from the rack the old and oily clay pipe, which was to him as a counsellor, and, having lit it, he leaned back in his chair, with the thick blue cloud-wreaths spinning up from him, and a look of infinite languor in his face.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Quite an interesting study, that maiden,” he observed. “I found her more interesting than her little problem, which, by the way, is rather a trite one.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: You will find parallel cases, if you consult my index, in Andover in ’77, and there was something of the sort at The Hague last year.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Old as is the idea, however, there were one or two details which were new to me. But the maiden herself was most instructive.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “You appeared to read a good deal upon her which was quite invisible to me,” I remarked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Not invisible but unnoticed, Watson. You did not know where to look, and so you missed all that was important.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I can never bring you to realise the importance of sleeves, the suggestiveness of thumb-nails, or the great issues that may hang from a boot-lace. Now, what did you gather from that woman’s appearance? Describe it.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, she had a slate-coloured, broad-brimmed straw hat, with a feather of a brickish red. Her jacket was black, with black beads sewn upon it, and a fringe of little black jet ornaments.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Her dress was brown, rather darker than coffee colour, with a little purple plush at the neck and sleeves. Her gloves were greyish and were worn through at the right forefinger.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Her boots I didn’t observe. She had small round, hanging gold earrings, and a general air of being fairly well-to-do in a vulgar, comfortable, easy-going way.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes clapped his hands softly together and chuckled.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “’Pon my word, Watson, you are coming along wonderfully. You have really done very well indeed.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is true that you have missed everything of importance, but you have hit upon the method, and you have a quick eye for colour. Never trust to general impressions, my boy, but concentrate yourself upon details.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: My first glance is always at a woman’s sleeve. In a man it is perhaps better first to take the knee of the trouser.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: As you observe, this woman had plush upon her sleeves, which is a most useful material for showing traces. The double line a little above the wrist, where the typewritist presses against the table, was beautifully defined.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The sewing-machine, of the hand type, leaves a similar mark, but only on the left arm, and on the side of it farthest from the thumb, instead of being right across the broadest part, as this was.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I then glanced at her face, and, observing the dint of a pince-nez at either side of her nose, I ventured a remark upon short sight and typewriting, which seemed to surprise her.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It surprised me.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “But, surely, it was obvious. I was then much surprised and interested on glancing down to observe that, though the boots which she was wearing were not unlike each other, they were really odd ones; the one having a slightly decorated toe-cap, and the other a plain one.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: One was buttoned only in the two lower buttons out of five, and the other at the first, third, and fifth.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Now, when you see that a young lady, otherwise neatly dressed, has come away from home with odd boots, half-buttoned, it is no great deduction to say that she came away in a hurry.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And what else?” I asked, keenly interested, as I always was, by my friend’s incisive reasoning.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I noted, in passing, that she had written a note before leaving home but after being fully dressed. You observed that her right glove was torn at the forefinger, but you did not apparently see that both glove and finger were stained with violet ink.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She had written in a hurry and dipped her pen too deep. It must have been this morning, or the mark would not remain clear upon the finger.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: All this is amusing, though rather elementary, but I must go back to business, Watson. Would you mind reading me the advertised description of Mr. Hosmer Angel?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I held the little printed slip to the light. “Missing,” it said, “on the morning of the fourteenth, a gentleman named Hosmer Angel.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: About five ft. seven in. in height; strongly built, sallow complexion, black hair, a little bald in the centre, bushy, black side-whiskers and moustache; tinted glasses, slight infirmity of speech.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Was dressed, when last seen, in black frock-coat faced with silk, black waistcoat, gold Albert chain, and grey Harris tweed trousers, with brown gaiters over elastic-sided boots.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Known to have been employed in an office in Leadenhall Street. Anybody bringing,” &c, &c.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “That will do,” said Holmes. “As to the letters,” he continued, glancing over them, “they are very commonplace.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Absolutely no clue in them to Mr. Angel, save that he quotes Balzac once. There is one remarkable point, however, which will no doubt strike you.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “They are typewritten,” I remarked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Not only that, but the signature is typewritten. Look at the neat little ‘Hosmer Angel’ at the bottom.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: There is a date, you see, but no superscription except Leadenhall Street, which is rather vague. The point about the signature is very suggestive—in fact, we may call it conclusive.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Of what?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “My dear fellow, is it possible you do not see how strongly it bears upon the case?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I cannot say that I do unless it were that he wished to be able to deny his signature if an action for breach of promise were instituted.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “No, that was not the point. However, I shall write two letters, which should settle the matter.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: One is to a firm in the City, the other is to the young lady’s stepfather, Mr. Windibank, asking him whether he could meet us here at six o’clock to-morrow evening.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is just as well that we should do business with the male relatives. And now, Doctor, we can do nothing until the answers to those letters come, so we may put our little problem upon the shelf for the interim.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I had had so many reasons to believe in my friend’s subtle powers of reasoning and extraordinary energy in action that I felt that he must have some solid grounds for the assured and easy demeanour with which he treated the singular mystery which he had been called upon to fathom.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Once only had I known him to fail, in the case of the King of Bohemia and of the Irene Adler photograph; but when I looked back to the weird business of the Sign of Four, and the extraordinary circumstances connected with the Study in Scarlet, I felt that it would be a strange tangle indeed which he could not unravel.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I left him then, still puffing at his black clay pipe, with the conviction that when I came again on the next evening I would find that he held in his hands all the clues which would lead up to the identity of the disappearing bridegroom of Miss Mary Sutherland.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: A professional case of great gravity was engaging my own attention at the time, and the whole of next day I was busy at the bedside of the sufferer.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It was not until close upon six o’clock that I found myself free and was able to spring into a hansom and drive to Baker Street, half afraid that I might be too late to assist at the _dénouement_ of the little mystery.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I found Sherlock Holmes alone, however, half asleep, with his long, thin form curled up in the recesses of his armchair.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: A formidable array of bottles and test-tubes, with the pungent cleanly smell of hydrochloric acid, told me that he had spent his day in the chemical work which was so dear to him.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, have you solved it?” I asked as I entered.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes. It was the bisulphate of baryta.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “No, no, the mystery!” I cried.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, that! I thought of the salt that I have been working upon. There was never any mystery in the matter, though, as I said yesterday, some of the details are of interest.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The only drawback is that there is no law, I fear, that can touch the scoundrel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Who was he, then, and what was his object in deserting Miss Sutherland?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The question was hardly out of my mouth, and Holmes had not yet opened his lips to reply, when we heard a heavy footfall in the passage and a tap at the door.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “This is the girl’s stepfather, Mr. James Windibank,” said Holmes. “He has written to me to say that he would be here at six. Come in!”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The man who entered was a sturdy, middle-sized fellow, some thirty years of age, clean-shaven, and sallow-skinned, with a bland, insinuating manner, and a pair of wonderfully sharp and penetrating grey eyes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He shot a questioning glance at each of us, placed his shiny top-hat upon the sideboard, and with a slight bow sidled down into the nearest chair.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Good-evening, Mr. James Windibank,” said Holmes. “I think that this typewritten letter is from you, in which you made an appointment with me for six o’clock?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Yes, sir. I am afraid that I am a little late, but I am not quite my own master, you know.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I am sorry that Miss Sutherland has troubled you about this little matter, for I think it is far better not to wash linen of the sort in public.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It was quite against my wishes that she came, but she is a very excitable, impulsive girl, as you may have noticed, and she is not easily controlled when she has made up her mind on a point.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Of course, I did not mind you so much, as you are not connected with the official police, but it is not pleasant to have a family misfortune like this noised abroad.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Besides, it is a useless expense, for how could you possibly find this Hosmer Angel?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “On the contrary,” said Holmes quietly; “I have every reason to believe that I will succeed in discovering Mr. Hosmer Angel.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Mr. Windibank gave a violent start and dropped his gloves. “I am delighted to hear it,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It is a curious thing,” remarked Holmes, “that a typewriter has really quite as much individuality as a man’s handwriting. Unless they are quite new, no two of them write exactly alike.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Some letters get more worn than others, and some wear only on one side. Now, you remark in this note of yours, Mr. Windibank, that in every case there is some little slurring over of the ‘e,’ and a slight defect in the tail of the ‘r.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: There are fourteen other characteristics, but those are the more obvious.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “We do all our correspondence with this machine at the office, and no doubt it is a little worn,” our visitor answered, glancing keenly at Holmes with his bright little eyes.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And now I will show you what is really a very interesting study, Mr. Windibank,” Holmes continued. “I think of writing another little monograph some of these days on the typewriter and its relation to crime.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is a subject to which I have devoted some little attention. I have here four letters which purport to come from the missing man. They are all typewritten.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: In each case, not only are the ‘e’s’ slurred and the ‘r’s’ tailless, but you will observe, if you care to use my magnifying lens, that the fourteen other characteristics to which I have alluded are there as well.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Mr. Windibank sprang out of his chair and picked up his hat. “I cannot waste time over this sort of fantastic talk, Mr. Holmes,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “If you can catch the man, catch him, and let me know when you have done it.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Certainly,” said Holmes, stepping over and turning the key in the door. “I let you know, then, that I have caught him!”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “What! where?” shouted Mr. Windibank, turning white to his lips and glancing about him like a rat in a trap.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Oh, it won’t do—really it won’t,” said Holmes suavely. “There is no possible getting out of it, Mr. Windibank.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It is quite too transparent, and it was a very bad compliment when you said that it was impossible for me to solve so simple a question. That’s right! Sit down and let us talk it over.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Our visitor collapsed into a chair, with a ghastly face and a glitter of moisture on his brow. “It—it’s not actionable,” he stammered.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I am very much afraid that it is not. But between ourselves, Windibank, it was as cruel and selfish and heartless a trick in a petty way as ever came before me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Now, let me just run over the course of events, and you will contradict me if I go wrong.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The man sat huddled up in his chair, with his head sunk upon his breast, like one who is utterly crushed.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Holmes stuck his feet up on the corner of the mantelpiece and, leaning back with his hands in his pockets, began talking, rather to himself, as it seemed, than to us.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it?
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He takes the obvious course of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then?
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It was only a joke at first,” groaned our visitor. “We never thought that she would have been so carried away.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Very likely not. However that may be, the young lady was very decidedly carried away, and, having quite made up her mind that her stepfather was in France, the suspicion of treachery never for an instant entered her mind.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: She was flattered by the gentleman’s attentions, and the effect was increased by the loudly expressed admiration of her mother. Then Mr. Angel began to call, for it was obvious that the matter should be pushed as far as it would go if a real effect were to be produced.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: There were meetings, and an engagement, which would finally secure the girl’s affections from turning towards anyone else. But the deception could not be kept up forever.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: These pretended journeys to France were rather cumbrous. The thing to do was clearly to bring the business to an end in such a dramatic manner that it would leave a permanent impression upon the young lady’s mind and prevent her from looking upon any other suitor for some time to come.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Hence those vows of fidelity exacted upon a Testament, and hence also the allusions to a possibility of something happening on the very morning of the wedding. James Windibank wished Miss Sutherland to be so bound to Hosmer Angel, and so uncertain as to his fate, that for ten years to come, at any rate, she would not listen to another man.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: As far as the church door he brought her, and then, as he could go no farther, he conveniently vanished away by the old trick of stepping in at one door of a four-wheeler and out at the other. I think that was the chain of events, Mr. Windibank!”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Our visitor had recovered something of his assurance while Holmes had been talking, and he rose from his chair now with a cold sneer upon his pale face.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “It may be so, or it may not, Mr. Holmes,” said he, “but if you are so very sharp you ought to be sharp enough to know that it is you who are breaking the law now, and not me.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I have done nothing actionable from the first, but as long as you keep that door locked you lay yourself open to an action for assault and illegal constraint.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “The law cannot, as you say, touch you,” said Holmes, unlocking and throwing open the door, “yet there never was a man who deserved punishment more.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: If the young lady has a brother or a friend, he ought to lay a whip across your shoulders. By Jove!” he continued, flushing up at the sight of the bitter sneer upon the man’s face, “it is not part of my duties to my client, but here’s a hunting crop handy, and I think I shall just treat myself to—”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: He took two swift steps to the whip, but before he could grasp it there was a wild clatter of steps upon the stairs, the heavy hall door banged, and from the window we could see Mr. James Windibank running at the top of his speed down the road.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “There’s a cold-blooded scoundrel!” said Holmes, laughing, as he threw himself down into his chair once more. “That fellow will rise from crime to crime until he does something very bad, and ends on a gallows.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The case has, in some respects, been not entirely devoid of interest.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “I cannot now entirely see all the steps of your reasoning,” I remarked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Well, of course it was obvious from the first that this Mr. Hosmer Angel must have some strong object for his curious conduct, and it was equally clear that the only man who really profited by the incident, as far as we could see, was the stepfather.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Then the fact that the two men were never together, but that the one always appeared when the other was away, was suggestive. So were the tinted spectacles and the curious voice, which both hinted at a disguise, as did the bushy whiskers.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: My suspicions were all confirmed by his peculiar action in typewriting his signature, which, of course, inferred that his handwriting was so familiar to her that she would recognise even the smallest sample of it. You see all these isolated facts, together with many minor ones, all pointed in the same direction.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And how did you verify them?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “Having once spotted my man, it was easy to get corroboration. I knew the firm for which this man worked.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: Having taken the printed description. I eliminated everything from it which could be the result of a disguise—the whiskers, the glasses, the voice, and I sent it to the firm, with a request that they would inform me whether it answered to the description of any of their travellers.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: I had already noticed the peculiarities of the typewriter, and I wrote to the man himself at his business address asking him if he would come here. As I expected, his reply was typewritten and revealed the same trivial but characteristic defects.
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: The same post brought me a letter from Westhouse & Marbank, of Fenchurch Street, to say that the description tallied in every respect with that of their employé, James Windibank. _Voilà tout_!”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “And Miss Sutherland?”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: “If I tell her she will not believe me. You may remember the old Persian saying, ‘There is danger for him who taketh the tiger cub, and danger also for whoso snatches a delusion from a woman.’
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view

segment_text: There is as much sense in Hafiz as in Horace, and as much knowledge of the world.”
scene_description: indoors, victorian room, fireplace, window view
